meanings.definition: The state or quality of being first in importance or degree.
meanings.sent1: Her primeness in the company made her the go-to person for important decisions.
meanings.sent2: The primeness of education is crucial for a successful society.
meanings.sent3: His primeness in always arriving early to meetings earned him the nickname 'Mr. Punctual'.
meanings.sent4: The primeness of honesty shines brightly in a world full of deceit.
meanings.sent5: The primeness of kindness can have a ripple effect on those around you.

meanings.definition: The state or quality of being in an early stage of development.
meanings.sent1: The primeness of the seedling showed promise for a strong tree to grow.
meanings.sent2: In the primeness of childhood, memories are formed that last a lifetime.
meanings.sent3: The primeness of the idea sparked excitement among the team.
meanings.sent4: Her talent was in the primeness of discovery, waiting to bloom.
meanings.sent5: The primeness of technology is constantly evolving and improving.

meanings.definition: The state or quality of being simple or basic.
meanings.sent1: The primeness of the recipe made it easy for beginners to follow.
meanings.sent2: In the primeness of communication, clarity is key.
meanings.sent3: His primeness in fashion was evident in his classic, minimalist style.
meanings.sent4: The primeness of the solution surprised everyone with its effectiveness.
meanings.sent5: The primeness of nature's beauty lies in its simplicity.
